subquestions.question_text: Describe the drawbacks of embedded systems.
subquestions.answer:
Drawbacks of embedded systems:
- It is difficult to change/update the firmware by the user
- Errors cannot be fixed easily // Troubleshooting/fault-finding/repairing is a specialist task/expensive
- Functionality cannot be changed/extended easily // Cannot be easily adapted for another task
- Faulty/outdated devices are often thrown away rather than repaired... leading to e-waste

subquestions.question_text: Identify one benefit of using DRAM instead of Static RAM (SRAM) in an embedded system.
subquestions.answer: DRAM is less expensive to manufacture/purchase than SRAM in the embedded system
answer_conditions: - DRAM is less expensive to manufacture/purchase than SRAM in the embedded system
- DRAM has a higher bit density per chip // more data can be stored per chip

subquestions.question_text: Give two differences between Erasable Programmable ROM (EPROM) and Electrically Erasable Programmable ROM (EEPROM).
subquestions.answer:
Differences between EPROM and EEPROM:
- EPROM uses ultraviolet light to erase data whilst EEPROM uses an electrical signal to do this
- EPROM has to be removed from the circuit board when changing the data whilst EEPROM remains in the circuit when the data is changed
- EPROM erases all the data, EEPROM can erase parts of the data

subquestions.question_text:
Complete the table by describing the purpose of each of the given registers. | Register | Purpose | | :--: | :--: | | Program Counter
(PC) | | | Memory Address
Register (MAR) | | | Memory Data
Register (MDR) | | | Index Register (IX) | |
subquestions.answer:
| Register | Purpose | | :--: | :--: | | Program Counter
(PC) | Stores the address of the next instruction to be fetched/executed | | Memory Address
Register (MAR) | Stores the address of the memory location where data will be read from/written to | | Memory Data
Register (MDR) | Stores the data read from the address in the MAR // stores the data to be written to the address in the MAR | | Index Register (IX) | Stores a number that will be added to the operand, to form the address of the data |

subquestions.question_text: Explain the benefits of connecting the monitor to the computer using the HDMI port instead of the VGA port.
subquestions.answer:
Benefits of using HDMI port instead of VGA port:
- HDMI has faster transfer rates than VGA
- HDMI supports the high resolution of the monitor
- HDMI supports video and audio transfer between computer and monitor speakers
- HDMI is digital interface therefore no data is lost in transfer to analogue and back
- HDMI is less prone to error/crosstalk/external interference

subquestions.question_text: Describe the process management tasks performed by an OS.
subquestions.answer:
Process management tasks performed by an OS:
- It manages the scheduling of processes // Decides which process is to be run next
- Allows multi-tasking/multi-processing
- Ensures fair access
- Handles interrupts
- Manages/allocates which resources the processes require
- Facilitates the sharing and exchange of data between processes
- Prevents interference between processes // conflict resolution

subquestions.question_text: Describe how the programmers can use the debugging features of a typical IDE during the development of the program.
subquestions.answer:
Debugging features of a typical IDE:
- Single stepping
- Run the program one line at a time
- Set breakpoints
- Variable/report watch window
- View how the data changes as the program is running

subquestions.question_text: Describe the benefits to the programmers of creating a program library.
subquestions.answer:
Benefits of creating a program library:
- Subroutines can be shared/reused
- A program library provides continuity between programs/programmers
- Individual programmers can contribute their specialisms to the library // Individual programmers can use the specialisms of others

subquestions.question_text:
Identify one security method that can be used to protect the program code from unauthorised access during email transfer.

Explain how your chosen method protects the program code.
subquestions.answer:
Security method: Encryption

Explanation:
- File contents are converted to cipher text
- If intercepted the data cannot be understood without the decryption key
answer_conditions: 1 mark for the security method. 2 marks for explanation

subquestions.question_text: Explain the reasons why the computer programmer needs to act ethically towards colleagues and the public.
subquestions.answer:
Reasons why the computer programmer needs to act ethically:

Colleagues:
- Treat colleagues fairly and avoid acts of discrimination
- Be prepared to accept/offer critique
- Credit the contributions of colleagues
- Help/train colleagues

The public:
- Maintain the health, safety and welfare of the public
- Be honest/realistic in making claims about the software
- Maintain the security of the public's data
answer_conditions: 1 mark for each bullet point max 2 for public max 2 for colleagues

subquestions.question_text: Identify one suitable type of software licence for the program and describe the reasons for your choice.
subquestions.answer:
Type of software licence: Open Source Initiative // Free Software Foundation

Reasons for choice:
- Allows program source code to be examined
- Allows the programmer to earn money for the software and updates
answer_conditions: 1 mark for Type of software licence

subquestions.question_text: Explain the reasons why the programmer should copyright their program.
subquestions.answer:
Reasons why the programmer should copyright their program:
- To identify themselves as the owner/author // To gain formal recognition of ownership
- To allow for legal consequences if anyone steals/copies it
- To restrict competition

subquestions.question_text: Explain the benefits of using a relational database instead of a file-based approach.
subquestions.answer:
Benefits of using a relational database:
- There is reduced data redundancy // less repeated data
- Data consistency is maintained // Data integrity is improved
- Program-data independence is ensured
- Complex queries are easier to run
- Different views can be provided
- Multiple concurrent access is possible

subquestions.question_text: Identify each relationship between the database tables and explain how each relationship can be implemented in the normalised database.
subquestions.answer:
Relationships between the database tables:
- CUSTOMER to JOB is 1 to many
- EMPLOYEE to LOGIN_DATA is 1 to 1
- JOB to JOB_EMPLOYEE is 1 to many
- EMPLOYEE to JOB_EMPLOYEE is 1 to many

subquestions.question_text: Write a Structured Query Language (SQL) script to return the total amount of all the invoices sent in the year 2023 that have been paid.
subquestions.answer:
SELECT SUM(Amount)
FROM INVOICE
WHERE Paid = "Y"
AND DateSent >= #01/01/2023# AND DateSent <= #31/12/2023#
answer_conditions: - From the correct table and one correct condition

subquestions.question_text:
Define the following bitmap terms.

Colour depth

File header
subquestions.answer:
Colour depth: the number of bits used to represent a colour // the number of colours that can be represented in an image

File header: stores data about the image file / metadata

subquestions.question_text: Explain why changing the image resolution will affect the image quality and file size.
subquestions.answer:
Image quality:
- Decreasing resolution means details within the image are lost because there are fewer pixels // Increasing resolution means the image is more detailed because there are more pixels

File size:
- Decreasing the resolution will decrease the file size because there are fewer pixels therefore less data // Increasing the resolution will increase the file size because there are more pixels therefore more data

subquestions.question_text: Identify one lossless method of compressing an image.
subquestions.answer: Run-Length Encoding

subquestions.question_text: Define the vector graphic terms property and drawing list.
subquestions.answer:
Property: an attribute of a drawing object // data about a shape // defines one aspect of the appearance of a drawing object

Drawing list: all the drawing objects/shapes in an image // stores the commands/descriptions / mathematical equations required to draw each object

subquestions.question_text:
Explain how bit manipulation can be used to test whether the binary number stored in the ACC represents an odd denary number.

Write the bit manipulation instruction that will be used.
subquestions.answer:
Explanation:
- An odd binary number will have a 1 in the Least Significant Bit (LSB)
- A bit manipulation operation is required to access/mask only the LSB and clear all the others
- Compare the result of the masking with denary 1
- The result of the comparison will be true if the number is odd

Instruction:
- AND B00000001 // AND #1 // AND &01
answer_conditions: 1 mark each to max 2 for explanation

subquestions.question_text: Explain whether the bridge warning system is an example of a monitoring system or of a control system.
subquestions.answer:
The bridge warning system is an example of a monitoring system:
- Because there is no use of feedback // the warning sign is only an indicator
- The output of the turning on of the sign does not affect the input of data from the sensors
- The system does not have any actuators
answer_conditions: 1 mark for each bullet point (max 2) for a correct justification
